page.title: 19MENDIP-RECENT CHANGES
page.content: Farming has changed greatly in recent years.Mechanisation has led to fewer but larger farms, some farms becoming abandoned as a result. New pesticides & fungicides mean that many crops now survive the mildew problems caused by the high rainfall of the plateau. Support buying policies of the EEC's Common Agricultural Policy have changed cereal farming on Mendip. Good prices have led to more peas and oil seed rape. The traditional sheep farming pattern of the plateau is now becoming rare, although many sheep are still sold at the annual Priddy Fair. Tourism, recreation & wild life conservation in nature reserves are all becoming important aspects of Mendip land use & have reduced the emphasis on agriculture.
